metadata.title: CVE-2021-23996 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
By utilizing 3D CSS in conjunction with Javascript, content could have been rendered outside the webpage's viewport, resulting in a spoofing attack that could have been used for phishing or other attacks on a user. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-23996` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
